term.name: automatism
term.source: From Greek automatismos: that which happens on its own.
term.def: The doctrine that the actions of animals are mechanistically determined. In particular, this doctrine is one constituent of &cartesianism;, since Descartes (1596-1650) advocated a strict &determinism; or &mechanism; in biology. Although automatism has little basis in biological fact, its core beliefs have persisted into recent times under different names (e.g., see &behaviorism;).
